verbose_text: While the complete loss of Dicer1 in mice results in early embryonic lethality, a considerable number of studies in female mice carrying a floxed allele of Dicer1 under the control of antimullerian hormone receptor 2 promoter driven Cre recombinase has revealed that these mice exhibit tubal hypotrophy with the formation of prominent tubal cysts, leading to the disruption of tubal transport, which is likely a result of abnormalities in the function of the uterotubal junction.
